title: 10. Augustus' Administrative Changes
description: Augustus’ reorganisation of Rome and the provinces, including urban administration, security, and financial control.

questions.question: Why did Augustus extend the pomerium of Rome?
options: To reflect the acquisition of new provinces
To reduce the size of the city

questions.question: How was the city of Rome reorganised under Augustus?
options: Into 14 districts overseen by magistrates chosen by lot
Into wards controlled by the army

questions.question: How many wards (vici) existed in Rome after Augustus’ reforms?
Who supervised the individual wards of Rome?
What was the role of the vigiles?
options: To act as a fire brigade and prevent fires

questions.question: How were the vigiles organised within the city of Rome?
What economic effect did Augustus’ building programme have?
options: It provided work for skilled and unskilled labourers

questions.question: Why did Augustus take control of the grain supply in 22 BCE?
What office did Augustus establish to oversee the grain supply?
Who was responsible for maintaining aqueducts before Augustus created a new board?
What change occurred after Agrippa’s death regarding water supply?
options: A board of three senatorial water curators was established
It was placed under military control

questions.question: What was the purpose of the urban cohorts?
Who commanded the urban cohorts?
What measures did Augustus take to prevent flooding in Rome?
How was provincial power divided under Augustus?
options: All provinces were governed by the Senate
All provinces were governed by Augustus
Provinces were divided into imperial and senatorial
Provinces were controlled by the army

questions.question: Why did Augustus retain control of imperial provinces?
options: They contained most of the military forces

questions.question: How were governors of imperial provinces selected?
options: Appointed by Augustus for three years or more

questions.question: What financial reform reduced corruption in the provinces?
options: Payment of salaries and expenses to governors

questions.question: What role did Augustus’ procurators play in provincial administration?
Why did Augustus keep Egypt under especially tight control?
options: It was a frequent source of rebellion
It supplied a third of Rome’s grain
